summary:
Trained originally as a geologist and engineer, I have decades of international leadership experience and strong people, technical and business skills. I believe that mutual understanding and cooperation lead to superior outcomes. One of my core talents is building bridges and aligning disparate compartmentalized groups of people towards common goals. I have repeatedly brought together people with very different agendas to find and implement solutions that go beyond better profitability, also enhancing environment, safety, wellness and people capability.
I have the ability to convince parties to “give back” parts of their gains so that others can make even bigger gains. This optimizes the system rather than components and improves end-to-end performance. The relationships and mutual understanding built further improve the sustainability of targets and go-forward plans.
I have been growing and leveraging these skills in multiple countries in ever more complex settings for 30+ years and in operational execution, planning and office roles. This culminated in integrating a multi-billion dollar acquisition into Shell, running mature producing assets, various director- and VP-ships and negotiating/setting-up a new Joint Venture. I have had external responsibilities at all levels and in diverse cultural environments and am natural in establishing genuine personal relationships.
